revision.text:
[[file:Ripbik Ellook.png|thumb|150px|Ripbik Ellook]] '''Ellooks''' are enemies in the {{XC|serieslink}}. They resemble elks, with gold or silver adornments, similar to [[Cervus]]es in {{XCX}}. They come in white and gold varieties.
== {{XC2|-}} == In {{XC2}}, Ellooks appear exclusively in the Kingdoms of [[Kingdom of Uraya|Uraya]] and [[Kingdom of Tantal|Tantal]]. === Normal Minor Enemies === * [[Dormic Ellook]] * [[Graze Ellook]] * [[Ripbik Ellook]]
=== Unique Monsters === * [[Deep-Green Oscar]] * [[Soothsayer Gerald]]
== {{TTGC|-}} == In {{TTGC}}, Ellooks can be found exclusively in the [[Loftin Nature Preserve]] of the [[Kingdom of Torna]]. === Normal Minor Enemy === * [[Astle Ellook]]
=== Unique Monster === * [[Beatific Ophelia]]
== {{XC3|-}} == In {{XC3}}, Ellooks appear exclusively in [[Erythia Sea]] and on [[Captocorn Peak]]. === Normal Minor Enemies === * [[Olkort Ellook]] * [[Scape Ellook]]
=== Unique Monsters === * [[Galloping Ghuldan]] * [[Timbercorn Cthinos]]
== {{XC3FR|sub}} == === Normal Minor Enemies === * [[Mona Ellook]] * [[Olkort Ellook]]
=== Unique Monster === * [[Treehugger Gerald]]
== Gallery == <gallery> Dormic Ellook.png|Dormic Ellook BeatificOpheliaDay.jpg|Beatific Ophelia Scape Ellook XC3.jpeg|Scape Ellook XC3 Timbercorn Cthinos.jpeg|Timbercorn Cthinos XC3 Galloping Ghuldan.png|Galloping Ghuldan </gallery> [[Category:XC2 Ellooks]] [[Category:XC2 Species]] [[Category:XC2 Beasts]] [[Category:TTGC Species]] [[Category:TTGC Beasts]] [[Category:TTGC Ellooks]] [[Category:XC3 Ellooks]] [[Category:XC3 Species]] [[Category:XC3 Terrestrial Life]] [[Category:XC3FR Ellooks]] [[Category:XC3FR Species]] [[Category:XC3FR Terrestrial Life]] [[Category:Ellooks]] [[Category:Species by Type]]

[[File:Makna_Eluca.jpg|thumb|An Eluca]] '''Elucas''' (Japanese: {{lang|ja|エルーカ}}, ''Erūka'') a family of enemies in the {{XC|serieslink}}. They are are pink, worm-like creatures resembling [[Caterpile]]s, although they tend to be larger. All Elucas look identical.
== {{XC|-}} == In {{XC}}, Elucas are found exclusively in [[Makna Forest]] and [[Eryth Sea]]. The [[Unique Monster (XC1)|Unique Monster]] Lazy Bluco, at level 34, is the most powerful Eluca. They are all [[Quest Enemy (XC1)|quest enemies]], as they drop needed items or must be defeated in certain quests but are not exclusive.
=== Normal Minor Enemies === * [[Makna Eluca]] * [[Perna Eluca]]
=== Unique Monster === * [[Lazy Bluco]]
== {{XCFC|sub}} == in {{XCFC|sublink}}, Elucas are found on the [[Bionis' Shoulder]].
=== Normal Minor Enemy === * [[Perna Eluca]]
=== Quest Exclusive Enemy === * [[Dozy Eluca]] (during ''[[Shoulder Survey Snaps]]'')
=== Unique Monster === * [[Buoyant Rostein]]
== {{XC2|-}} == In {{XC2}}, Elucas are found in the [[Leftherian Archipelago]].
=== Normal Minor Enemy === * [[Mayn Eluca]]
=== Quest Exclusive Enemy === * [[Moks Eluca]] (during ''[[Maiden Voyage]]'')
=== Challenge Battle Mode Enemy === * [[Baythe Eluca]]
== {{XC3|-}} == In {{XC3}}, Elucas are found in the [[Cadensia Region]].
=== Normal Minor Enemies === * [[Baccura Eluca]] * [[Parasite Eluca]]
=== Unique Monster === * [[Widdershins Radler]]
== Gallery == <gallery> Perna Eluca.png|Perna Eluca in {{XC|-}} MoksEluca.jpg|Moks Eluca in {{XC2|-}} </gallery>

{{Infobox quest |name = Enemies and Allies |image = XC3 Enemies and Allies.jpg |description = ''Go to Colony Iota's Storehouse. It seems that Alexandria wants to open up about colony affairs in the hope of gaining the party's trust'' |giver = [[Alexandria]] |location = [[Elaice Highway]] ([[Colony Iota Canteen]]) |prereqs = Chapter 4 started
''[[Her Reasons]]'' completed
[[Alexandria]] in the party
''Colony Iota Goods'' discussed |reclevel = Lv. 41 |rewards = 400 [[Colony Iota]] [[Affinity (XC3)|Affinity]]
1760 [[Experience Points (XC3)|EXP]]
1940 [[Gold|G]]
3 [[Soul Points|SP]]
15 [[Colony Iota Goods]] }} '''Enemies and Allies''' is a [[Quest (XC3)|Standard Quest]] in {{XC3}}. == Objectives == # ''Talk with the specified character(s).'' #* [[Rhyza]] #** Rhyza is found at the [[Great Liente Shelf]]. # ''Head for the specified location(s).'' #* [[Hidden Stash]] # ''Use the [[Collectopaedia (XC3)|Collectopaedia Card]] to send over supplies to [[Colony 4]].'' # ''Talk with the specified character(s).'' #* [[Chelle]] == Results == ''"Collectopaedia Cards can now be used to send supplies to other colonies. Alexandria and the others consider it a worthwhile investment."'' == Trivia == * If ''[[Rousing Bolearis]]'' has completed, instead of [[Ethel]], [[Bolearis]] will be the one to receive the Colony Iota Goods for Colony 4. {{clr}} {{xc3 stub}} [[Category:XC3 Standard Quests]] [[Category:Fornis Region Quests]]

{{for|other uses|Enemy}} {{spoiler}} '''Enemies''' are the AI-controlled opponents faced by the party in {{XC3}} and {{XC3FR|sublink}}.
== Overview == Enemies can be found throughout the world of [[Aionios]], alone or in groups, and can be fought by the party to gain experience or progress in the story. When enemies are defeated, the party gains [[Experience Points (XC3)|EXP]] and two other skill points.
There are four types of monsters: [[Normal Monster]]s, [[Elite Monster]]s, [[Unique Monster (XC3)|Unique Monsters]], and [[Lucky Monster]]s.<ref>https://twitter.com/XenobladeJP/status/1524277610389602304?s=20&t=b55NHDvmkr7quHfA5znvYQ</ref>
* Normal monsters are usually members of a species, reflected in the second part of their names (for example, [[Heavy Brog (XC3)|Heavy Brog]] are members of the [[Brog]] family). * Elite monsters are monsters that are stronger than normal monsters. They can be identified by a blue icon on the sides of its nameplate. * Lucky monsters are as powerful as normal monsters, but defeating them rewards better items. They are identified by a shine on its nameplate. * Unique monsters are powerful monsters with names that consist of an adjective and a name. They can be identified by a red icon on the sides of its nameplate.
Enemies, like playable characters, have levels and use [[Battle Arts (XC3)|arts]] in battle.
A complete list of enemies in {{XC3|-}} and {{XC3FR|sub}} can be found at [[List of Enemies in Xenoblade Chronicles 3]].
== Skirmishes == {{main|Skirmish}} Occasionally, the party will encounter groups of soldiers or monsters fighting one another in the field. They can choose to join either side of the battle, with each offering different rewards, such as [[Gold]], [[Experience Points (XC3)|Bonus Experience]], [[Affinity (XC3)|Affinity]] with a local colony, or [[Nopon Coin (XC3)|Nopon Coins]]. However, when the party is helping one group as part of a [[Quest (XC3)|quest]], it is not possible to join the other group. {{clr}}
== Gallery == === In-Game Renders === <gallery> Icon enemy type 0.png|Enemy Type Icons </gallery> === Screenshots === <gallery> XC3 Types of Monsters.jpeg XC3 Lucky Enemy.jpeg|A Lucky Monster </gallery>
== References == <references />

'''Enraged''' (Japanese: {{lang|ja|怒り}}, ''ikari'', anger or hatred) is a recurrent enemy-exclusive [[buff]] in {{XC|serieslink}}.
== {{XC|-}} == It is comparable to the [[Crazed]] status from {{XC}}.
== {{XCX|-}} == The Enraged status in {{XCX}} increases the stats of the [[Enemy (XCX)|enemy]] under its effects, and may have bonus effects for certain species. The majority of enemy species can gain this buff when their [[Hit Points (XCX)|Hit Points]] have been reduced to a low amount or an appendage has been destroyed. A few enemy species cannot become Enraged. The buff can wear off after enough time has passed.
When Enraged becomes active, the enemy will play a special animation before resuming its attacks. Enraged is marked by a unique particle effect on the enemy consisting of black ashes and red bolts of lightning rising around the enemy.
Enraged will not activate whilst the enemy is suffering from [[Launch (XCX)|Launch]], [[Knockback (XCX)|Knockback]], [[Flinch]], [[Stun]], [[Stagger]], [[Topple (XCX)|Topple]], [[Sleep (XCX)|Sleep]], or [[Control]].
== {{XC2|-}} and {{TTGC|-}} == In {{XC2}} and {{TTGC}}, the Enraged status enhances the ability of the [[Enemy (XC2)|enemy]] under its effects (such as gaining boosts to stats, dealing more damage, gaining a [[Spike (XC2)|counterspike]], and more), and allows certain enemies to unleash stronger [[Battle Arts (XC2)|arts]]. The majority of enemy species can gain this buff when their [[Hit Points (XC2)|Hit Points]] have been reduced to less than half, or after using a specific art. Kindred enemies might also enrage in response to others getting the status. Many enemies' [[Blade (XC2)#Elements|element]] will change after becoming enraged.
A few stationary enemy species cannot become Enraged, such as [[Nest]]s, [[Pod]]s, [[Parisax|Parisax Eggs]] and [[Standard]]s. With the exception of special encounters such as [[Boss (XC2)|bosses]], some [[Quest Exclusive Enemy (XC2)|quest exclusive enemies]] and some [[Unique Monster (XC2)|Unique Monsters]], most enemies below level 25 cannot become Enraged.
When the Enraged aura becomes active, a unique particle effect briefly surrounds the enemy consisting of red flames circling around the enemy. From version 1.5.0 onwards, a red pulsating icon will appear next to the enemy's name once it has become Enraged.
It can be dispelled by [[Corvin]]'s Level 2 [[Blade Special]] [[Lacerna Noctis]].
=== Rage Strikes === Exclusively on Bringer of Chaos [[Difficulty Levels|difficulty]], Enraged enemies may unleash a '''Rage Strike'''. This status effect powers up the first art used by the enemy after enraging, multiplying its damage by 300%.
Every time this powerful art connects with a party member, it will also drain the [[Party Gauge (XC2)|Party Gauge]] by half a bar segment (50 points). If an enemy is capable of enraging multiple times, then it can also use Rage Strikes multiple times per battle.
== {{XC3|-}} == [[File:XC3 Enraged 01.jpg|thumb|180px|The Enraged icon on an enemy's HP gauge]] Powerful [[Enemy (XC3)|enemies]] in {{XC3}}, such as [[Unique Monster (XC3)|Unique Monster]]s and [[Boss (XC3)|Boss]]es, have an Enraged mark on their [[Hit Points (XC3)|HP]] gauge, usually at half. When its HP goes below that mark, the enemy becomes Enraged. An Enraged enemy has increased attack power, and depending on the species, may gain access to new Arts or have additional effects. [[Smash (XC3)|Smash]] has the negative side effect of moving the mark up, allowing the enemy to become Enraged earlier. [[Burst]] deactivates Enraged for a certain amount of time. {{clr}}
== References == <references />

[[Category:XCX Status]] [[Category:XC2 Status]] [[Category:TTGC Status]] [[Category:XC3 Status]]

{{Infobox XC3 Enemy |name = Equites |image = XC3 - Equites.png |caption = Equites |category = Normal Enemy |type = [[Levnis]] |level = 15 - 47 |area = [[Eagus Wilderness]]
[[Caitlin Drum]]
[[Yzana Plains]]
[[Captocorn Peak]]
[[Keves Castle]] |spawntime = Anytime |respawn = Yes |movement = |detection = |exp = |cp = |sp = |gold = 113 }} '''Equites''' are enemies in {{XC3}} and ''[[Xenoblade Chronicles 3: Future Redeemed|Future Redeemed]]''. They are [[Keves]]i [[Levnis]]es, and can be found at level 15 in [[Eagus Wilderness]] and [[Bennel Cave]], level 19 - 21 in [[Caitlin Drum]], 30 - 47 in [[Yzana Plains]] and [[Captocorn Peak]] in the [[Aetia Region]], and in [[Keves Castle]]. One is seen accompanying [[Valdi]] alongside a [[Velites]] during his Hero Quest, 2 more aid [[Garvel]], [[Layla]], and [[Hoope]] during their boss fight during [[Lanz]]'s [[Hero Quest]], and [[Joran]] was run over by one's wheel in one of his past lives prior to becoming a [[Moebius]]. They drop [[Equites Tank Wheel]]s and [[Equites Loading Core|Loading Cores]] when defeated. One Equites aids some Kevesi Troops in hunting down 3 citizens from the City. == Stats == {{Enemy stats}} === Arts === {{Enemy arts|art1=[[Spit Beam]]|art2=Flip Wheel|art3=Rampage Drive}} == In {{XC3FR|sub}} == {{Infobox XC3 Enemy |name = Equites |image = Equites FR.jpg |caption = Equites |category = Normal Minor Enemy |type = [[Levnis]] |level = 38 |area = [[Vermilion Woods]] ([[Colony 5 Wreckage]]) |spawntime = After reaching the [[Black Mountains]] |respawn = Yes |movement = |detection = |exp = }} '''Equites''' are Normal Minor Enemies in {{XC3FR}}. They are [[Keves]]i [[Levnis]]es, and can be found at level 38 near the [[Colony 5 Wreckage]] in [[Vermilion Woods]] after reaching the [[Black Mountains]]. {{clr}} == Etymology == The name Equites is named after the Roman societal class of the [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Equites same name]. {{clr}} {{xc3 stub}} {{fr stub}} [[Category:XC3 Minor Enemies]] [[Category:XC3FR Minor Enemies]] [[Category:Aetia Region Enemies]] [[Category:Keves Castle Region Enemies]] [[Category:Vermilion Woods Enemies]] [[Category:XC3 Levnises]] [[Category:XC3FR Levnises]] [[Category:XC3 Level 26-30 Enemies]] [[Category:XC3 Level 46-50 Enemies]] [[Category:XC3FR Level 36-40 Enemies]] [[Category:XC3 Bosses]] [[Category:XC3 Story Exclusive Enemies]] [[Category:XC3 Quest Exclusive Enemies]] [[Category:XC3 Quest Enemies]] [[Category:XC3 Challenge Battle Enemies]] [[Category:XC3 Enemy pages needing stats]] [[Category:XC3 Enemy pages needing drops]] [[Category:XC3FR Enemy pages needing stats]] [[Category:XC3FR Enemy pages needing drops]]
